newsitem.title: PUERTO RICO: Delta employees arrested in Puerto Rico drug case.
newsitem.headline: Delta employees arrested in Puerto Rico drug case.

text.p: Twelve members of a drug trafficking ring, most of whom are past or current employees of Delta Air Lines, were indicted on charges that they smuggled cocaine through Puerto Rico into the United States, U.S. officials said on Wednesday.

The organisation shipped hundreds of pounds (kilos) of Colombia cocaine through Puerto Rico's Luis Munoz Marin International Airport, Drug Enforcement Administration special agent Felix Jimenez said. Nine of those indicted were arrested on Wednesday and three are still being sought.
:Delta employees arrested in Puerto Rico drug case
Jimenez said the Delta employees used their positions in the airline industry to put cocaine filled suitcases and cargo containers on board Delta aircraft.
"What is important is that this was airline employees," he told Reuters in a telephone interview. "This is the first time we have had an organised ring operating like that."
Delta spokeswoman Kim King told Reuters: "We are aware that some delta employees were arrested in conjunction with illegal drug activity. We cooperated fully with the DEA in this investigation."

Jimenez said the investigation began with the seizure of 1,140 lb (517 kilos) of cocaine at the Delta cargo area of the Puerto Rico airport on Sept. 21, 1995. Seven of those indicted were arrested in Puerto Rico. One was taken into custody in Orlando, Florida, and the other in Cincinnati.
